name: The Sam Sheppard Murder Case Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: The murder of Dr. Sheppard's wife occurred in a suburb of which of these cities?
questions.explanation:
Cleveland.

	Marilyn Sheppard, wife of Dr Shepard was found dead in the Sheppard's Cleveland home on July 4, 1954. She was 31 and pregnant; her 7-year old son was in a nearby room.

questions.text: The murder occurred on what holiday?
questions.explanation:
July 4.

	As noted above, the murder occurred during the early hours of Sunday morning. It was July 4, 1954.

She was beaten.

	She was found beaten to death in her bed.

questions.text: Where did Dr. Sheppard claim to be at the time of the crime?
options: Taking a drive in his car
questions.explanation:
Asleep downstairs.

	Dr. Sheppard claimed to have dozed off downstairs after the departure of some friends who had been visiting on Saturday night.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT true (according to Dr. Sheppard)?
questions.correct: He observed a one-armed man leaving his home
options: He observed a man with bushy red hair
He grappled with an intruder in the Sheppard's bedroom
He chased an intruder out of the home
questions.explanation:
He observed a one-armed man leaving his home.

	Dr. Sheppard claimed to have been awakened by noise from the bedroom. He ran upstairs, observed his bleeding and struggled with an intruder.The intruder ran from the home; Sheppard pursued. The bushy red hair identifiying feature was turned into a a one-armed man for the TV series.

questions.text: Which of the following statements accurately describes the media's handling of the first trial of Dr. Sheppard?
questions.explanation:
Carnival atmosphere.

	The trial court was soundly criticized for allowing the trial to turn into a circus.

questions.text: Who represented Dr. Sheppard after the first trial?
questions.explanation:
F Lee Bailey.

	A relatively young F Lee Bailey entered the scene after trial #1.

questions.text: What was the verdict of the second trial?
questions.explanation:
Not Guilty.

	Sheppard went through a full trial and was found "not guilty" by the jury.

questions.text: Which of the following is true?
options: Dr Sheppard's father died of cancer and ulcer problems
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	The two suicides were by gunshot. Dr Sheppard wasn't the only one whose life was devastated by the events.

questions.text: How old was Dr Sheppard when he died?
questions.explanation:
46.

	It's easy to understand how the incredible events of Sheppard's life may well have worn him out.
